blocks.name: ax-rep
blocks.content: Axiom of Replacement. An axiom scheme of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. Axiom 5 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 19. It tells us that the image of any set under a function is also a set (see the variant ~ funimaex ). Although ` ph ` may be any wff whatsoever, this axiom is useful (i.e. its antecedent is satisfied) when we are given some function and ` ph ` encodes the predicate "the value of the function at ` w ` is ` z ` ". Thus, ` ph ` will ordinarily have free variables ` w ` and ` z ` - think of it informally as ` ph ( w , z ) ` . We prefix ` ph ` with the quantifier ` A. y ` in order to "protect" the axiom from any ` ph ` containing ` y ` , thus allowing us to eliminate any restrictions on ` ph ` . Another common variant is derived as ~ axrep5 , where you can find some further remarks. A slightly more compact version is shown as ~ axrep2 . A quite different variant is ~ zfrep6 , which if used in place of ~ ax-rep would also require that the Separation Scheme ~ axsep be stated as a separate axiom. There is a very strong generalization of Replacement that doesn't demand function-like behavior of ` ph ` . Two versions of this generalization are called the Collection Principle ~ cp and the Boundedness Axiom ~ bnd . Many developments of set theory distinguish the uses of Replacement from uses of the weaker axioms of Separation ~ axsep , Null Set ~ axnul , and Pairing ~ axpr , all of which we derive from Replacement. In order to make it easier to identify the uses of those redundant axioms, we restate them as axioms ~ ax-sep , ~ ax-nul , and ~ ax-pr below the theorems that prove them. (Contributed by NM, 23-Dec-1993.)

axiom ax-rep(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wex(s1, wal(s2, wi(wal(s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))), wex(s1, wal(s2, wb(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wex(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s3)), wal(s1, w0)))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
}

axiom ax-rep(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,(‚àÄ(s1, w0)‚Üí s2 = s1))))‚Üí ‚àÉ(s1, ‚àÄ(s2,(s2 ‚àà s1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 ‚àà s3 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s1, w0)))))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)

}

blocks.name: axrep1
blocks.content: The version of the Axiom of Replacement used in the Metamath Solitaire applet ~ http://us.metamath.org/mmsolitaire/mms.html . Equivalence is shown via the path ~ ax-rep ` -> ` ~ axrep1 ` -> ` ~ axrep2 ` -> ` ~ axrepnd ` -> ` ~ zfcndrep = ~ ax-rep . (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2005.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)

  ax-rep(s0, s1, s2, hs0, w0)
  albii(s0, wex(s1, wal(s2, wi(wal(s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))), wex(s1, wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))))
  exbii(s1, wal(s2, wi(wal(s1, w0), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))), wal(s2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))

  |- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(wex(s2, wi(w0, wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2)))))), wex(s2, wi(w0, wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
} = {
  exbidv(s2, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2))))), wi(w0, wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2))))))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0, wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2)))), wal(s3, wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2)))))
  albidv(s3, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2))), wb(w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2))))
  bibi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w1, wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2)), wex(s4, wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2)))
  exbidv(s4, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2), wa(wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)), w2))
  anbi1d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s5), cv(s0)), w2, wcel(cv(s5), cv(s1)))

  ‚ä¢ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí(‚àÉ(s2,(w0 ‚Üí ‚àÄ(s3,(w1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s4,(s5 ‚àà s0 ‚àß w2))))))‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(w0 ‚Üí ‚àÄ(s3,(w1 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s4,(s5 ‚àà s1 ‚àß w2))))))))

blocks.name: axrep5
blocks.content: Axiom of Replacement (similar to Axiom Rep of [BellMachover] p. 463). The antecedent tells us ` ph ` is analogous to a "function" from ` x ` to ` y ` (although it is not really a function since it is a wff and not a class). In the consequent we postulate the existence of a set ` z ` that corresponds to the "image" of ` ph ` restricted to some other set ` w ` . The hypothesis says ` z ` must not be free in ` ph ` . (Contributed by NM, 26-Nov-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Oct-2016.)

  alrimi(s2, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))))

  exbid(s2, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wcel(cv(s2), cv(hs0)), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s2), c0), w0))
  nfeq2(s2, cv(hs0), c0)

  syl(hs0 = c0, ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚àß w0))))), ‚àÄ(s2,(s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(w0 ‚Üí s1 = s0))))))
  alrimi(s2, hs0 = c0, (s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(w0 ‚Üí s1 = s0)))))
  syl6bi(hs0 = c0, s2 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(w0 ‚Üí s1 = s0))), s2 ‚àà c0)
  axrep5(s2, hs0, s0, s1, w0)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  exbidv(s0, hs0 = c0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚àß w0)))), ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0)))))
  albidv(s1, hs0 = c0, (s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚àß w0))), (s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0))))
  bibi2d(hs0 = c0, s1 ‚àà s0, ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚àß w0)), ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0)))
  exbid(s2, hs0 = c0, (s2 ‚àà hs0 ‚àß w0), (s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0))
  nfeq2(s2, hs0, c0)
  anbi1d(hs0 = c0, s2 ‚àà hs0, w0, s2 ‚àà c0)
  eleq2(hs0, c0, s2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0))))))
  diff.cv.s(s2, hs0)

blocks.name: zfrep3cl
blocks.content: An inference based on the Axiom of Replacement. Typically, ` ph ` defines a function from ` x ` to ` y ` . (Contributed by NM, 26-Nov-1995.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfrep3cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s2), c0), w0)))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s2), c0), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  zfrepclf(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0)
  nfcv(s2, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm zfrep3cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà s0 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s2,(s2 ‚àà c0 ‚àß w0)))))
  ‚ä£ c0 ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ (s2 ‚àà c0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(w0 ‚Üí s1 = s0))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
} = {
  zfrepclf(s0, s1, s2, c0, w0)
  nfcv(s2, c0)
}

blocks.name: zfrep4
blocks.content: A version of Replacement using class abstractions. (Contributed by NM, 26-Nov-1995.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfrep4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wcel(cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(w0, w1))), universe)
  -| wcel(cab(s1, w0), universe)
  -| wi(w0, wex(s2, wal(s0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w1)
} = {
  eqeltrri(cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(w0, w1))), universe, cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1))))
  abbii(s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)), wex(s1, wa(w0, w1)))
  exbii(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1), wa(w0, w1))
  anbi1i(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1, w0)
  issetri(s2, cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1))))
  mpbir(wex(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1))))), wex(s2, wal(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1))))))
  zfrepclf(s2, s0, s1, cab(s1, w0), w1)
  nfab1(s1, w0)
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), wex(s2, wal(s0, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))), w0)
  abid(s1, w0)
  exbii(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cab(s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)))), wal(s0, wb(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)))))
  abeq2(s0, cv(s2), wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)))
  diff.cab.s(s2, s0, wex(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)))
  diff.wex.s(s2, s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1))
  diff.wa.s(s2, wcel(cv(s1), cab(s1, w0)), w1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, cv(s1), cab(s1, w0))
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.cab.s(s2, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cab.s(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm zfrep4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  ‚ä¢ { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(w0 ‚àß w1))} ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ { s1 | w0 } ‚àà ùïå
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí ‚àÉ(s2, ‚àÄ(s0,(w1 ‚Üí s0 = s2))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, w1)
} = {
  eqeltrri({ s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(w0 ‚àß w1))}, universe, { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))})
  abbii(s0, ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1)), ‚àÉ(s1,(w0 ‚àß w1)))
  exbii(s1, (s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1), (w0 ‚àß w1))
  anbi1i(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 }, w1, w0)
  issetri(s2, { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))})
  mpbir(‚àÉ(s2, s2 = { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))}), ‚àÉ(s2, ‚àÄ(s0,(s0 ‚àà s2 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))))))
  zfrepclf(s2, s0, s1, { s1 | w0 }, w1)
  nfab1(s1, w0)
  sylbi(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 }, ‚àÉ(s2, ‚àÄ(s0,(w1 ‚Üí s0 = s2))), w0)
  abid(s1, w0)
  exbii(s2, s2 = { s0 | ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))}, ‚àÄ(s0,(s0 ‚àà s2 ‚Üî ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1)))))
  abeq2(s0, s2, ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1)))
  diff.cab.s(s2, s0, ‚àÉ(s1,(s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1)))
  diff.wex.s(s2, s1, (s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 } ‚àß w1))
  diff.wa.s(s2, s1 ‚àà { s1 | w0 }, w1)
  diff.wcel.s(s2, s1, { s1 | w0 })
  diff.cv.s(s2, s1)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)
  diff.cab.s(s2, s1, w0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s1)
  diff.cab.s(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}
